concept.title: The Command Name
concept.shortdesc: A ConTeXt command is formed by a backslash (\) and a series of letters.

conbody.p: A ConTeXt command name cannot include numbers.

note.p: ConTeXt allows users to define commands.
A good practice for naming user-defined commands is to use title case (TitleCase) to ensure that new command names do not conflict with command names that are already defined by ConTeXt.

link.desc: Each ConTeXt command must have a name, and may also take setups (either as keywords, keyval pairs, or sets of each) and can have a scope.
